pattern cast on 70 stitches on us 8 5 mm circular needles starting with row 1 ws work as follows row 1-15 knit to last 2 sts slip last 2 sts purlwise wyif row 16 rs k2 repeat yo k2tog until last 2 sts slip last 2 sts purlwise wyif repeat row 1-16 until you have reached approximately your desired length ending the last repeat after knitting row 14 which is a rs row tip if you ve lost count of your row number to determine whether it s time to knit another row 16 observe your work and count how many garter bump row you have created since your last eyelet row if you count 8 of them it means it s time to knit another row 16 my ideal circumference for a double-wrapped cowl is around 125-130 cm but you should feel encouraged to do a quick try-on the fabric should wrap around your neck twice and the two edges should be able to meet comfortably please remember that knitted fabric typically stretches after blocking if you want to err on the side of caution block your project at this stage by soaking it and letting it dry flat try it on and if you need to continue repeating row 1-16
